uploadTooltip:
The preferred way to publish data is by using Python and R packages.

 However, you can also upload images or CSV files by this button.

landing.top_links: More about dstack.ai in our launch article and 2020 roadmap.
landing.main_title: Build interactive data science apps easily
landing.main_description: dstack.ai is a platform that drives collaboration between data scientists and the rest of the company by letting data scientists conveniently build dashboards, reports, and ML prototypes.
landing.examples_title: A platform for data scientists to track and share their analysis results
landing.examples_description: Use Python or R APIs to publish datasets and data visualizations to dstack.ai. Share your data analysis results with your team and clients and exchange rapid feedback.
landing.examples_tab1_description: Build and deliver interactive reports and dashboards in minutes, not days. No development required.
landing.examples_tab2_description: Share datasets across your company. Manage access. Track revisions.
landing.examples_tab3_description: Use pandas, numpy, plotly, dstack, and other Python scientific packages to run continuous scientific jobs on the server.
landing.howItWorks_description: Follow four simple steps to organize your data analysis process in your team
landing.howItWorks_step1_description:
with dstack.ai. Just an email address,
 password, and username required.
landing.howItWorks_step2_description: Uploading visualization and datasets to dstack.ai is done via the Python or R packages. These packages can be used from dstack.ai jobs, your own Jupyter notebooks, RMarkdown, Python or R scripts and applications.
landing.howItWorks_step2_more: For more details on the API and code samples, check out the documentation.
landing.howItWorks_step3_title: Combine visualizations and datasets into interactive dashboards
landing.howItWorks_step3_description: All you need to create a dashboard is to select the needed stacks and choose the layout. The parameters for all stacks will be shown in the top. Once your data is published, you and your teammates can access its latest version with
landing.howItWorks_step3_tip_description: You’ll publish data using your secure token that you’ll find in the Settings after you create an account with dstack.ai.
landing.howItWorks_step4_description:
Share datasets and data visualization with your team or client
 and exchange feedback and comments interactively.

All data reports can be accessed via a
 mobile-friendly web application.

pricing.title: Plans and pricing
pricing.description: Find the best suitable plan for yourself and your team. Free 30-day trial. No credit card needed.
pricing.note: All prices here are monthly prices based on annual charging.
pricing.collaborator: Collaborator — user on the dstack frontend
pricing.creator: Creator — data scientist using dstack APIs on client side

landing.pricing_modal_description: Our team is happy to answer your questions. Fill out the form and we'll be in touch as soon as possible.
landing.try_description: Only a couple of minutes to get free access to the Team plan of dstack.ai. Connect your data, create stacks, and collaborate with teammates!
landing.success_question_modal_sutitle: We’ll contact you via email you left as soon as possible.
landing.success_request_modal_sutitle: We’ll contact you via email you left as soon as possible.
landing.cookie_text: We use cookies for the following purposes: to enable certain functions of the service, to provide analytics, to store your preferences, to enable advertisements delivery, including behavioral advertising. If you'd like to delete cookies or instruct your web browser to delete or refuse cookies, please visit the help pages of your web browser.

formErrors.no-spaces-stack: No spaces required in the stack name!
